node.title: Army to help drive COVID-19 testing blitz as Katherine braces for spike in case numbers
node.alt: Two defence personnel speaking with health workers on a verge, next to a truck, in Katherine.
node.description: Australian Defence Force personnel will help conduct a coronavirus testing blitz in at-risk areas of Katherine today in a bid to stamp out the region's growing outbreak.
node.content:
["Australian Defence Force personnel will help drive a coronavirus testing blitz in at-risk parts of Katherine where residents have struggled to access testing facilities.", "The number of cases in the Northern Territory's current outbreak stands at 37, with a jump in cases expected today as tests come back from communities in hard lockdown.", "Authorities are concerned there could be undetected COVID cases moving about in Katherine East due to continuous positive wastewater results in a nearby catchment.", "A spokesperson told the ABC the ADF personnel would work with health teams to transport people in Katherine East to testing clinics and return them home.", "Authorities last week said a lack of transport may be a factor in the low testing rates, an issue also highlighted by the Aboriginal groups working with the communities now in hard lockdown.", "At yesterday's COVID press conference,\u00a0Chief Minister Michael Gunner said he was pleased 1,170 people had turned up to get tested in Katherine on Sunday.", "The spike followed several days of low testing numbers ranging from 220 to 550.", "However, NT Police Commissioner Jamie Chalker said despite some recent improvements, testing numbers and vaccination rates had to be higher, particularly for \"Aboriginal people in the Katherine area\".", "", "
Commissioner Chalker urged Katherine residents to get tested for COVID.(ABC News: Peter Garnish)
", "He said about\u00a040 ADF personnel were already on the ground in Katherine and surrounding areas helping with compliance and education.", "He said the ADF were not being\u00a0required to \"do any enforcement\".", "Twenty personnel will assist police at three control points around Katherine.", "They include a turn-off near Binjari, one of two remote communities currently under a hard lockdown.", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
